briefTitle: Effect of Paracervical Block Volume on Pain Control for Dilation and Curettage.o

20cc 1% lidocaine with 2 units of vasopressin paracervical block

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Women over the age of 18 presenting to UC San Diego and UC Los Angeles
2. Undesired pregnancy or missed abortion \< 11 weeks 6 days gestation
3. Must speak English or Spanish
4. Desire surgical termination of pregnancy or management of miscarriage in clinic

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Women with a diagnosis of inevitable or incomplete abortion
2. Desire for general anesthesia or IV sedation
3. Chronic pain conditions
4. Any medical comorbidities that are a contraindication to performing the procedure in the clinic setting
5. Allergy to or refusal of ketorolac, oral Versed, or a paracervical block
6. If they have taken any pain medications the day of presentation to clinic
7. If they have taken Misoprostol the day of presentation to clinic

outcomeMeasures.title: Pain With Cervical Dilation
outcomeMeasures.description: Distance (mm) from the left of the 100-mm Visual Analog Scale (VAS) (reflecting magnitude of pain) recorded at time of cervical dilation. Pain will be assessed using a 100 mm visual analogue scale with the anchors 0 = none, 100 mm = worst imaginable.

outcomeMeasures.title: Pain With Uterine Aspiration
outcomeMeasures.description: Distance (mm) from the left of the 100-mm Visual Analog Scale (VAS) (reflecting magnitude of pain) recorded immediately after uterine aspiration. Pain will be assessed using a 100 mm visual analogue scale with the anchors 0 = none, 100 mm = worst imaginable.

outcomeMeasures.title: Pain 10 Minutes Post Procedure
outcomeMeasures.description: Distance (mm) from the left of the 100-mm Visual Analog Scale (VAS) (reflecting magnitude of pain) recorded 10 minutes after the completion of the procedure. Pain will be assessed using a 100 mm visual analogue scale with the anchors 0 = none, 100 mm = worst imaginable.

outcomeMeasures.title: Overall Pain
outcomeMeasures.description: Distance (mm) from the left of the 100-mm Visual Analog Scale (VAS) (reflecting magnitude of pain) recorded after the procedure reflecting the overall pain felt during the procedure. Pain will be assessed using a 100 mm visual analogue scale with the anchors 0 = none, 100 mm = worst imaginable.
